title: Privacy Playbook for High Profile Wine and Spirits Sales
metaTitle: Privacy Guide for High Profile Sellers | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: How high-net-worth individuals, celebrities, and executives can sell wine collections discreetly. NDAs, private transport, and anonymous sales.
summary: How to keep identities and collections discreet during quoting, shipping, and payment.

sections.heading: Quick Answer
content: High-profile sales require discretion. Security and anonymity are our top priorities for VIP clients.
list: Use a representative (House Manager/PA) to handle communications.
Request an NDA before sharing the inventory list.
Ensure the buyer does not market the 'Celebrity Collection' aspect without permission.

sections.heading: Why Privacy Matters
content: Revealing a sale can signal financial distress, divorce, or relocationâ€”information you may not want public. Furthermore, security at the residence is paramount.

sections.heading: Our Safety Protocols
content: We handle data for athletes, politicians, and executives regularly.
list: Data Isolation: Seller identity is restricted to essential ops staff only.
Secure Payments: Wires are sent discreetly to entities or trusts.
No Press: We do not issue press releases or social media posts about your sale.

sections.heading: Representation (Staff)
content: We are happy to work through your inner circle.
list: We can communicate entirely via your PA or Family Office Manager.
The Principal never needs to speak to us directly if authorized staff are in place.

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
list: Using a public auction house (they often WANT to market your name to boost prices).
Sending photos with identifiable background features (art, family photos) visible.
Using a personal email address for inquiries (use a dedicated or staff email).

sections.heading: What to Do Next
list: State your requirement for an NDA.
Submit photos that show bottles, not the room.
Relax while we handle the logistics.

faqs.question: Can I sell anonymously?
faqs.answer: To us, no (we must potentialy verify identity for anti-fraud/legal reasons), but to the public, YES. We are the end buyer.

faqs.question: Do you publish sold prices?
faqs.answer: No. Unlike auctions, our transaction is private and prices are not public record.

faqs.question: Can you pickup at night/weekends?
faqs.answer: Yes, we can arrange logistics to suit your security team's schedule.

faqs.question: Do you need my home address for a quote?
faqs.answer: No, just the city/state for logistics planning. We only need the full address for pickup.

faqs.question: Will you background check me?
faqs.answer: We perform standard due diligence to ensure legal ownership, but this is internal only.
